intro: Adenandra rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf adenandra, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its glossy, rounded leaves and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in coastal and mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in spring and attract various pollinators. Adenandra rotundifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
